meanings.definition: A person who looks after someone or something.
meanings.sent1: The minder watched over the children playing in the park.
meanings.sent2: The zookeeper acted as a minder for the baby animals.
meanings.sent3: The minder made sure the lost puppy found its way back home.
meanings.sent4: The security guard was like a vigilant minder protecting the valuable jewels.
meanings.sent5: The elderly lady hired a minder to care for her garden while she was away.

meanings.definition: A person who is responsible for the safety of a group of people.
meanings.sent1: The lifeguard acted as a minder at the crowded beach.
meanings.sent2: The bodyguard served as a minder for the celebrity at the event.
meanings.sent3: The minder ensured all the hikers returned safely from the mountain.
meanings.sent4: The captain of the ship was the ultimate minder during the storm.
meanings.sent5: The firefighter bravely acted as a minder in the burning building.

meanings.definition: A person who supervises a group of workers.
meanings.sent1: The foreman was the minder overseeing the construction crew.
meanings.sent2: The manager acted as a minder for the employees in the office.
meanings.sent3: The minder made sure the workers took their lunch breaks on time.
meanings.sent4: The team leader was a strict minder when it came to project deadlines.
meanings.sent5: The supervisor was a supportive minder, always ready to help the staff.
